examples: he gave out money to the poor

results.definition: knocked unconscious by a heavy blow
to state openly and publicly one's homosexuality
be made known; be disclosed or revealed

examples: in our house dancing and playing cards were out

results.definition: being out or having grown cold
(baseball) a failure by a batter or runner to reach a base safely in baseball
examples: you only get 3 outs per inning

results.definition: directed outward or serving to direct something outward

examples: that style is out these days

results.definition: not allowed to continue to bat or run
examples: he was tagged out at second on a close play

results.definition: not worth considering as a possibility
examples: a picnic is out because of the weather

results.definition: out of power; especially having been unsuccessful in an election

examples: the out surface of a ship's hull

results.definition: reveal (something) about somebody's identity or lifestyle
examples: The gay actor was outed last week
